description: Numbers n such that 60^n - 59^n is prime.
comments: Terms greater than 1000 often correspond only to strong pseudoprimes 60^n-59^n. [Clarified by _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 15 2013]a(4) > 10^5. - _Robert Price_, Mar 01 2013
links: H. Lifchitz, R. Lifchitz, PRP top records (of the form 60^n-59^n)
author: _Mike Oakes_, May 18 2001, May 19 2001
